snippet: It’s time to erase the notion that the tax break for charitable giving benefits the rich at society’s expense.
abstract: Robert J Shiller Economic View column warns lawmakers to avoid altering the charitable deduction during negotiations on the tax code; holds that deduction has done a great deal of good in country, and springs from some of its deepest values.
lead_paragraph: It’s time to erase the notion that the tax break for charitable giving benefits the rich at society’s expense.

headline.print_headline: Please Don’t Mess With the Charitable Deduction
headline.seo: The Charitable Deduction and Why It Needs to Stay
headline.main: Please Don’t Mess With the Charitable Deduction
